snippet: A federal judge on Monday ruled that a white former employee had no standing to bring claims of racial discrimination in a lawsuit against Paula Deen, the celebrity chef.
abstract: Federal Judge William T Moore Jr throws out discrimination suit against celebrity chef Paula Deen, ruling that former employee Lisa T Jackson has no standing to bring claims of racial discrimination.

byline.contributor: Kim Severson contributed reporting from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Monday ruled that a white former employee had no standing to bring claims of racial discrimination in a lawsuit against Paula Deen, the celebrity chef.

headline.main: Racial Bias Claim Dismissed for Paula Deen
headline.print_headline: Judge Says Chef’s Aide Has No Case Of Race Bias
